config.name: editor
config.desc: The TreeEditor or xtype data to display when clicked.

config.name: listeners
singleExpand
config.desc: true if only 1 node per branch may be expanded

config.name: ddAppendOnly
config.desc: True if the tree should only allow append drops (use for trees which are sorted)

config.name: dragConfig
config.desc: Custom config to pass to the {@link Roo.tree.TreeDragZone} instance

config.name: enableDrop
config.desc: true to enable just drop

config.name: hlColor
config.desc: The color of the node highlight (defaults to C3DAF9)

config.name: rendererTip
config.desc:
DEPRECATED - use TreeLoader:create event / Sets the rendering (formatting) function for the nodes hovertip to return HTML markup for the tree view. The render function is called with the following parameters:
  • The {Object} The data for the node.

config.name: enableDD
config.desc: true to enable drag and drop

config.name: hlDrop
config.desc: false to disable node highlight on drop (defaults to the value of Roo.enableFx)

config.name: renderer
config.desc:
DEPRECATED - use TreeLoader:create event / Sets the rendering (formatting) function for the nodes. to return HTML markup for the tree view. The render function is called with the following parameters:
  • The {Object} The data for the node.

config.name: rootVisible
config.desc: false to hide the root node (defaults to true)

config.name: enableDrag
config.desc: true to enable just drag

config.name: ddGroup
config.desc: The DD group this TreePanel belongs to

config.name: lines
config.desc: false to disable tree lines (defaults to true)

config.name: dropConfig
config.desc: Custom config to pass to the {@link Roo.tree.TreeDropZone} instance

config.name: selModel
config.desc: A tree selection model to use with this TreePanel (defaults to a {@link Roo.tree.DefaultSelectionModel})

config.name: loader
config.desc: A TreeLoader for use with this TreePanel

config.name: containerScroll
config.desc: true to register this container with ScrollManager

config.name: ddScroll
config.desc: true to enable YUI body scrolling

config.name: animate
config.desc: true to enable animated expand/collapse (defaults to the value of Roo.enableFx)

config.name: pathSeparator
config.desc: The token used to separate sub-paths in path strings (defaults to '/')

methods.name: getLoader
methods.desc: Returns the default TreeLoader for this TreePanel

methods.name: render
methods.desc: Trigger rendering of this TreePanel

methods.name: getSelectionModel
methods.desc: Returns the selection model used by this TreePanel

methods.name: expandPath
methods.desc: Expands a specified path in this TreePanel. A path can be retrieved from a node with {@link Roo.data.Node#getPath}

params.name: attr
params.desc: (optional) The attribute used in the path (see {@link Roo.data.Node#getPath} for more info)

params.name: callback
params.desc:
(optional) The callback to call when the expand is complete. The callback will be called with
(bSuccess, oLastNode) where bSuccess is if the expand was successful and oLastNode is the last node that was expanded.

methods.name: expandAll
methods.desc: Expand all nodes

methods.name: getChecked
methods.desc: Retrieve an array of checked nodes, or an array of a specific attribute of checked nodes (e.g. "id")

params.name: attribute
params.desc: (optional) Defaults to null (return the actual nodes)

params.name: startNode
params.desc: (optional) The node to start from, defaults to the root

methods.name: selectPath
methods.desc: Selects the node in this tree at the specified path. A path can be retrieved from a node with {@link Roo.data.Node#getPath}

params.name: attr
params.desc: (optional) The attribute used in the path (see {@link Roo.data.Node#getPath} for more info)

params.name: callback
params.desc:
(optional) The callback to call when the selection is complete. The callback will be called with
(bSuccess, oSelNode) where bSuccess is if the selection was successful and oSelNode is the selected node.

methods.name: getEl
methods.desc: Returns the container element for this TreePanel

methods.name: collapseAll
methods.desc: Collapse all nodes

methods.name: setRootNode
methods.desc: Sets the root node for this tree.

methods.name: getRootNode
methods.desc: Returns the root node for this tree.

methods.name: getNodeById
methods.desc: Gets a node in this tree by its id.

methods.name: purgeListeners
methods.desc: Removes all listeners for this object

methods.name: on
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this element (shorthand for addListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

methods.name: un
methods.desc: Removes a listener (shorthand for removeListener)

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: addEvents
methods.desc: Used to define events on this Observable

params.name: object
params.desc: The object with the events defined

methods.name: releaseCapture
methods.desc: Removes all added captures from the Observable.

methods.name: removeListener
methods.desc: Removes a listener

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the handler

methods.name: fireEvent
methods.desc: Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name).

params.name: args
params.desc: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers

methods.name: hasListener
methods.desc: Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The name of the event to check for

methods.name: capture
methods.desc: Starts capture on the specified Observable. All events will be passed to the supplied function with the event name + standard signature of the event before the event is fired. If the supplied function returns false, the event will not fire.

params.name: scope
params.desc: (optional) The scope (this object) for the fn

methods.name: addListener
methods.desc: Appends an event handler to this component

params.name: eventName
params.desc: The type of event to listen for

params.name: scope
params.desc:
(optional) The scope in which to execute the handler
function. The handler function's "this" context.

params.name: options

events.name: *dblclick
events.desc: Fires when a node is double clicked

events.name: *contextmenu
events.desc: Fires when a node is right clicked

events.name: *beforeclick
events.desc: Fires before click processing on a node. Return false to cancel the default action.

events.name: *checkchange
events.desc: Fires when a node with a checkbox's checked property changes

events.name: *nodedragover
events.desc:
Fires when a tree node is being targeted for a drag drop, return false to signal drop not allowed. The dragOverEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source.
  • cancel - Set this to true to signal drop not allowed.

events.name: *beforeexpand
events.desc: Fires before a node is expanded, return false to cancel.

events.name: *collapse
events.desc: Fires when a node is collapsed

events.name: *beforenodedrop
events.desc:
Fires when a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree for preprocessing. Return false to cancel the drop. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Drop node(s) provided by the source OR you can supply node(s) to be inserted by setting them on this object.
  • cancel - Set this to true to cancel the drop.

events.name: *beforechildrenrendered
events.desc: Fires right before the child nodes for a node are rendered

events.name: *textchange
events.desc: Fires when the text for a node is changed

events.name: *load
events.desc: Fires when a node is loaded

events.name: *startdrag
events.desc: Fires when a node starts being dragged

events.name: *click
events.desc: Fires when a node is clicked

events.name: *expand
events.desc: Fires when a node is expanded

events.name: *enddrag
events.desc: Fires when a drag operation is complete

events.name: *nodedrop
events.desc:
Fires after a DD object is dropped on a node in this tree. The dropEvent passed to handlers has the following properties:
  • tree - The TreePanel
  • target - The node being targeted for the drop
  • data - The drag data from the drag source
  • point - The point of the drop - append, above or below
  • source - The drag source
  • rawEvent - Raw mouse event
  • dropNode - Dropped node(s).

events.name: *dragdrop
events.desc: Fires when a dragged node is dropped on a valid DD target

params.name: dd
params.desc: The dd it was dropped on

events.name: *beforecollapse
events.desc: Fires before a node is collapsed, return false to cancel.

events.name: *disabledchange
events.desc: Fires when the disabled status of a node changes

events.name: *beforeload
events.desc: Fires before a node is loaded, return false to cancel

events.name: *append
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is appended to a node in this tree.

params.name: index
params.desc: The index of the newly appended node

events.name: *beforemove
events.desc: Fires before a node is moved to a new location in the tree. Return false to cancel the move.

params.name: newParent
params.desc: The new parent the node is moving to

params.name: index
params.desc: The index it is being moved to

events.name: *insert
events.desc: Fires when a new child node is inserted in a node in this tree.

params.name: refNode
params.desc: The child node the node was inserted before

events.name: *beforeappend
events.desc: Fires before a new child is appended to a node in this tree, return false to cancel the append.

params.name: node
params.desc: The child node to be appended

events.name: *move
events.desc: Fires when a node is moved to a new location in the tree

params.name: oldParent
params.desc: The old parent of this node

params.name: newParent
params.desc: The new parent of this node

params.name: index
params.desc: The index it was moved to

events.name: *beforeremove
events.desc: Fires before a child is removed from a node in this tree, return false to cancel the remove.

params.name: node
params.desc: The child node to be removed

events.name: *remove
events.desc: Fires when a child node is removed from a node in this tree.

events.name: *beforeinsert
events.desc: Fires before a new child is inserted in a node in this tree, return false to cancel the insert.

params.name: node
params.desc: The child node to be inserted

params.name: refNode
params.desc: The child node the node is being inserted before
